items.title: More than 29,000 head of livestock dead or missing in north-west Qld, as BOM predicts potential cyclone
items.summary: The number of livestock found dead across north-west Queensland is expected to rise, but for already devastated producers, a potential cyclone brings the threat of more rain.

items.title: Derailed freight train shuts part of key national railway line. Here's what we know
items.summary: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

items.title: Labor fundraiser at centre of Minns donations allegations bigger than official records suggest, newspaper report shows
items.summary: A decade-old Labor fundraiser at the centre of allegations that NSW Premier Chris Minns conspired to evade a state donations law was reported at the time as a much bigger event than official records suggest, the ABC can reveal.

items.title: Organiser of Indigenous deaths in custody rally vows to defy NSW protest laws
items.summary: Paul Silva says he plans to defy NSW's new protest restrictions to rally against Indigenous deaths in custody.

items.title: NATO faces unpredictable threat from Donald Trump as US eyes Greenland
items.summary: Donald Trump has made it clear he's departing from decades of US foreign policy norms and once-close allies are now questioning what it could mean for them.

items.title: Heatwave breakdown state-by-state as breeze offers just a brief reprieve
items.summary: A breeze will bring a brief reprieve for coastal areas of Victoria and South Australia today before the heat and fire danger ramps up again tomorrow.

items.title: Today in History, January 8: 'El Chapo' recaptured in bloody raid
items.summary: "Mission accomplished: we got him," began the triumphant tweet from Mexico's then-president Enrique Peña Nieto.

items.title: Property losses, warnings for bushfires across Victoria as firefighters prepare for 'catastrophic' conditions
items.summary: Emergency warnings remain in place as out-of-control blazes continue to burn in Victoria ahead of "catastrophic" fire conditions on Friday.

items.title: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's Brisbane International campaign ends in loss to French duo
items.summary: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's doubles campaign at the Brisbane International has come to an end after an entertaining tiebreak decider against France.

items.title: US seizes more oil tankers as it lays out three-phase plan for Venezuela
items.summary: Russia says one of the Venezuela-linked tankers is "our vessel" and demands the quick release of its citizens, as the US pledges to continue seizing ships and keep the pressure on Venezuela's interim leaders.

items.title: WA police launch search for Kenneth John Giles, 58, after gunshot near Mullewa, woman injured
items.summary: A manhunt is underway for 58-year-old Kenneth John Giles who allegedly fled with a firearm after a shooting on a rural property near Mullewa, about 450 kilometres north of Perth, with a woman suffering non-life-threatening injuries.

items.title: Nestlé recalls select batches of Alfamino infant formula
items.summary: The precautionary measure is over concerns that the product could contain a toxin that can cause food poisoning symptoms.

items.title: Maida Vale, High Wycombe fire extinguished after closing parts of Roe Highway
items.summary: Ground and aerial crews successfully control a bushfire that closed a section of Roe Highway and brought traffic to a standstill.

items.title: Ashes 2026: Jacob Bethell, England's biggest hope and biggest blunder, sets up Sydney finale
items.summary: Jacob Bethell's brilliant maiden Test century sets up an intriguing finish in Sydney, but leaves everyone bemused as to where this precocious young player has been all summer.

items.title: Wednesday finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Beau Webster sparks another English meltdown and Jacob Bethell brings tears — quick hits from day four of the SCG Test
items.summary: Beau Webster sparks a classic English meltdown as Jacob Bethell brings tears while Ben Stokes fails to finish another series. Here are your quick hits from day four of the SCG Test.

items.title: Hot, gusty conditions are expected to ramp up on Friday across SA and Vic to the east of a trough (see: dotted line).

items.title: Cosmetic nurse banned for two years after injecting botox without consulting doctor or obtaining prescription
items.summary: An AHPRA investigation found Thia Sullivan injected a patient without doctor consultation or a script, falsified records, and urged patients not to co-operate with police.

items.title: Major heatwave moves across Australia
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Staff at new Noarlunga mental health unit 'visibly distressed and crying', union says
items.summary: South Australia's doctors' union has raised concerns that clinicians were distressed when asked to admit more patients at a new mental health unit at Noarlunga Hospital when staffing levels were "not clinically safe".

items.title: Songs from the Hottest 100 of 2005 that should have been higher
items.summary: Arctic Monkeys were that low!? These are the tunes from triple j's Hottest 100 of 20. years ago that deserved to have placed higher.

items.title: Kimberly Birrell, Olivia Gadecki, Emerson Jones record second-round losses at Brisbane International
items.summary: Australian players Kimberly Birrell and Olivia Gadecki have fallen in the second round of the Brisbane International, along with rising star Emerson Jones, who went out after a high-quality encounter with the world number 17.

items.title: Heatwave conditions likely to bring increase of flies and maggots
items.summary: Forecast heatwave conditions across large parts of the country could mean flies and maggots are more prevalent. Here's how to deal with them.

items.title: Aboriginal artist Bobbi Lockyer in tears as Australia Post loses $4k painting
items.summary: Indigenous artist Bobbi Lockyer has been left frustrated after she sent a $4,000 custom artwork of the Pilbara to a buyer in Queensland, only for an empty cardboard sleeve to be delivered.

items.title: Israel clears final hurdle to start settlement construction that would cut the West Bank in two
items.summary: Critics say the E1 project would prevent the establishment of a contiguous Palestinian state.

items.title: Council calls in diggers as big swells deposit masses of seaweed on Sydney beaches
items.summary: Piles of kelp were removed from a popular Sydney beach, although some councils prefer to leave the seaweed for its environmental benefit.

items.title: Why does Trump want Greenland and why is it so important?
items.summary: Donald Trump's continued interest in Greenland is part of his "America First" agenda to dominate the Western Hemisphere and contain China's interests in the region.

items.title: Melbourne tram enthusiasts join fight to save India's last tram network
items.summary: Melbourne's iconic trams thrive in a car-centred world, but Asia's oldest tramway is now facing extinction.

items.title: Truck crashes into five cars on Picton Road at Cataract, north of Wollongong
items.summary: More than a dozen people were assessed by paramedics after a truck smashed into several cars on a major road north of Wollongong.

items.title: Past works reimagined in Second Look — Legacy, the Australian Design Centre's final exhibition
items.summary: Second Look — Legacy celebrates sustainable making while paying homage to one of the most influential figures in Australia craft and design.

items.title: How to avoid heatstroke and when to call Triple Zero in a heatwave
items.summary: Extreme heat forecast for the next few days has prompted warnings form health experts. Here's how to stay safe.

items.title: Poland to face Australia in United Cup quarterfinals after Hubert Hurkacz wins singles against the Netherlands
items.summary: Poland will meet the host nation in the last eight of the mixed-teams event after in-form Hubert Hurkacz beat Tallon Griekspoor of the Netherlands in Sydney.

items.title: Ben Stokes limps off during fourth day of final Ashes Test at SCG
items.summary: Ben Stokes left the field during the first session of the fourth day at the SCG, with England confirming their skipper was being assessed for a right adductor injury.

items.title: Who is Nicolás Maduro Guerra, the son of Venezuela's deposed leader?
items.summary: Nicolás Maduro Guerra rose through the ranks of his father's government and remains in Caracas. It's uncertain for how long.

items.title: Southern Outlet crash between truck and bus sees 17 people treated at Royal Hobart Hospital
items.summary: A peak-hour crash on Hobart's Southern Outlet leads to 17 people being assessed at the Royal Hobart Hospital.

items.title: Inflation cools in November with consumer prices rising 3.4pc but still above the RBA's target
items.summary: Inflation cooled in November, with the consumer price index rising 3.4 per cent over the year, down from 3.8 per cent a month earlier. Some economists continue to forecast a February rate hike, however.

items.title: Bayer's Monsanto sues Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna over mRNA technology
items.summary: Bayer's Monsanto has sued Pfizer, BioNTech and Moderna for allegedly misusing its messenger RNA technology in COVID vaccines.

items.title: AI hallucinations and the dilemma of false or misleading information
items.summary: When a journalist emails a company with questions looking for answers, the least they expect is a real person to feed them the spin, half-truths or outright lies. Not a machine.

items.title: Perth Bears sign Bulldogs forward Josh Curran ahead of 2027 NRL entry
items.summary: The Perth Bears land their most experienced NRL player so far in their recruitment drive, signing Canterbury's Josh Curran on a three-year deal.

items.title: Mystery over safe with beef jerky inside recovered from Shark Bay's ocean floor
items.summary: While hoping for treasure, a nervous Quoin Sellenger was left with a (sadly) inedible salty snack after retrieving a safe from the bottom of WA's Shark Bay.

items.title: Ashes 2026: Jacob Bethell stars on day four, Beau Webster triple strike halts England momentum at SCG
items.summary: England ends day four with a 119-run lead after a sparkling century to 22-year-old Jacob Bethell, with Beau Webster's late wickets halting the tourists' momentum.

items.title: Emergency warnings issued for Victorian fires as heatwave sweeps southern Australia — as it happened
items.summary: Southern Australia is enduring its most intense heatwave in years, with temperatures set to soar from today until the weekend.

items.title: Travellers urged not to rely solely on navigation systems for directions following recent strandings
items.summary: A young couple got bogged on a remote dirt road in north Queensland and was forced to walk hours in search of help after trusting their navigation app to find a 24-hour fuel station.

items.title: The tough balance of circumstance and support systems as WA woman faces eviction
items.summary: As protesters strive to keep a woman from community housing eviction, the complexities of her situation collide with a housing provider's options.

items.title: Ukraine's allies agree to security guarantees in 'significant step' towards ending Russia's invasion
items.summary: At a key meeting in Paris, officials from Europe, Canada, the US and NATO say they will provide Kyiv's frontline forces with equipment and training, and back them up with air, land and sea support to deter any future Russian attack.

items.title: Kids at tiny school work to save extremely rare 'flying jewel' purple copper butterfly
items.summary: It's the size of a 10-cent piece and matures under the guard of protective ants, but the purple copper butterfly needs more help to survive — and a group of NSW primary school students has stepped up to the challenge.

items.title: Outback NT hotel at centre of Peter Falconio mystery barred from serving alcohol
items.summary: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

items.title: Insurer Prosura hit by cyber data breach, customers contacted by 'threat actor'
items.summary: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".

items.title: Fire on southern NSW property likely sparked by cigarette butt
items.summary: A southern NSW landholder is urging smokers to think twice when disposing of their cigarette butts, after a grassfire razed her property.

items.title: Gulf Country prepares for weeks of isolation, as north-east Qld coast braces for tropical low
items.summary: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued a severe weather warning for the north Queensland coast as a tropical low approaches.

items.title: Half of Canberra's Commonwealth Avenue Bridge is closing for two years. Here's what you need to know
items.summary: Commuters in Canberra are facing major disruptions as Commonwealth Avenue Bridge undergoes two years of major upgrades.

items.title: Australians trapped on Yemen's Socotra island after Saudi Arabia, UAE flare-up
items.summary: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

items.title: Echidna population count underway in Queensland amid urbanisation and climate change fears
items.summary: The lack of knowledge about the species has experts worried echidnas could decline without anyone noticing.

items.title: Trump has no plan after removing Maduro, Schumer says, after 'troubling' classified briefing — as it happened
items.summary: The Democrats' Senate leader, Chuck Schumer, says he has received a classified briefing from the White House on Donald Trump's plans for Venezuela — and is dismayed by the lack of detail.

items.title: Venezuelans celebrate a future reclaimed — but insiders warn the power struggle is just getting started
items.summary: Venezuelans celebrate what once felt impossible — but inside the country, armed powerbrokers, nervous officials and rival factions are already jostling over what comes next.

items.title: María Corina Machado vows to return to Venezuela following ousting of Nicolás Maduro by US
items.summary: In her first interview since the ousting of President Nicolás Maduro, María Corina Machado says she is confident she will win any election held in Venezuela.

items.title: A severe heatwave is crossing Tasmania.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Total fire ban declared for parts of Victoria and SA as heatwave begins
items.summary: Firefighters in Victoria continue to battle a bushfire in the state's north-east as a heatwave brings temperatures near 45 degrees Celsius to some parts of the country.

items.title: Trump's intervention in Venezuela heralds an incomparable era
items.summary: The global shock caused by the Trump administration's interventions in Venezuela sent analysts scurrying for historic comparisons, but nothing really compares to what happened at the weekend.

items.title: Military force 'always an option' for Greenland, White House says
items.summary: The US president and his officials are continuing to push for an American takeover of the Danish territory, saying the island is needed for national security.

items.title: US set to back Ukraine defence coalition if peace deal made with Russia
items.summary: A draft statement outlines what Ukraine's allies could commit to if Russia attacks its neighbour again in the future.

items.title: What Venezuela's deposed president and first lady are accused of
items.summary: The US has justified the seizure of deposed Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and wife Cilia Flores by arguing they had breached US domestic law. So what exactly have they been accused of doing?

items.title: Human remains found in search for snorkeller missing off WA's Ledge Point
items.summary: Police confirm human remains have been found washed ashore north of Perth, believed to be those of a 32-year-old man missing since New Year's Day.
